TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PipeStream extends System.IO.Stream
Public MustInherit Class PipeStream Inherits Stream
public ref class PipeStream abstract : System::IO::Stream

summary.span: 公开管道周围的 对象，该对象同时支持匿名管道和命名管道。

span.span: Exposes a object around a pipe, which supports both anonymous and named pipes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类的.NET Framework 中的命名和匿名管道操作提供的基类。The class provides the base class for named and anonymous pipes operations in the .NET Framework. 使用和命名的管道操作的类。Use the and classes for named pipe operations. 使用和匿名管道操作的类。Use the and classes for anonymous pipe operations. 有关管道的详细信息，请参阅[管道](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md)。For more information about pipes, see [Pipes](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md). 匿名管道的示例，请参阅[如何： 使用匿名管道进行本地进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of anonymous pipes, see [How to: Use Anonymous Pipes for Local Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md). 命名管道的示例，请参阅[如何： 使用命名管道进行网络进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of named pipes, see [How to: Use Named Pipes for Network Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md).

span.span: for full trust for inheritors.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任代码继承此类。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

param.name: buffer

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read.

span.span: A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.

summary.span: 开始异步读操作。

span.span: Begins an asynchronous read operation.

returns.span: 引用异步读取的 对象。

span.span: An object that references the asynchronous read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值传递对象传递给方法来确定已读取的字节数，并释放操作系统资源用于进行读取。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必须为每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在调用的相同代码或在传递给回调。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读取操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果管道已关闭或是无效自变量传递给，会立即引发相应异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 正在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求过程中发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 代码调用时，会引发这些异常方法。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

is less than 0.
-or-
is less than 0.

exception.span: 大于 中可用的字节数。

span.span: is greater than the number of bytes available in .
The pipe is closed.
The pipe does not support read operations.

exception.span: 管道已断开连接，正在等待连接，或尚未设置句柄。

span.span: The pipe is disconnected, waiting to connect, or the handle has not been set.

exception.span: 管道已损坏或出现其他 I/O 错误。

span.span: The pipe is broken or another I/O error occurred.

param.name: disposing
param.span: 若要释放托管资源和非托管资源，则为 ；若仅释放非托管资源，则为 。

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放 类使用的非托管资源，并可以选择释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当处置参数为`true`，此方法释放任何托管对象所持有的所有资源，此对象引用。When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this object references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

span.para: 在派生类中，将所有中的清除逻辑方法。 可以由其他对象多次调用。重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息并，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

In derived classes, put all cleanup logic in the method. can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回之前调用指定的字节数组中读取的字节数。This method returns the number of bytes read into the byte array specified by the earlier call to . 返回值传递对象传递给方法来确定已读取的字节数，并释放操作系统资源用于进行读取。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必须为每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在调用的相同代码或在传递给回调。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读取操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果管道已关闭或是无效自变量传递给，会立即引发相应异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 正在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求过程中发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 代码调用时，会引发这些异常方法。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 访问控制列表 (ACL) 介绍个人和/或组，或没有执行权限在指定的文件上执行特定操作。An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否已连接 对象。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a object is connected.

span.span: if the object is connected; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回`true`仅当连接对象。The property returns `true` only if the object is connected. 如果此属性返回`false`，管道可能会在等待连接，或可能会断开连接、 关闭时或中断。If this property returns `false`, the pipe may be waiting to connect, or may be disconnected, closed, or broken.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Read (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read([in]unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer) As Integer
public: override int Read(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count);
override this.Read : byte[] * int * int -> int

param.name: buffer
param.span: 此方法返回时，该缓冲区包含指定的字节数组，该数组的 offset 和 (offset + count - 1) 之间的值由从当前源中读取的字节替换。

span.span: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

param.name: offset
param.span: buffer 数组中的字节偏移量，其中读取的字节将被替换。

span.span: The byte offset in the buffer array at which the bytes that are read will be placed.

param.name: count
param.span: 最多读取的字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read.

summary.span: 从流中读取字节块，并将数据写入指定的缓冲区。

span.span: Reads a block of bytes from a stream and writes the data to a specified buffer.

returns.span: 读取到 的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes that are read into .

returns.span: 如果当前可用的字节数没有请求的那么多，则此数小于请求的字节数；或如果已到达流的末尾，则为零。

span.span: This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream is reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读取操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 调用方法进行阻止，直到`count`读取的字节数或到达流的结尾。Calling the method blocks until `count` bytes are read or the end of the stream is reached. 异步读取操作，请参阅和。For asynchronous read operations, see and . ## Examples 以下示例创建一个匿名管道客户端和管道服务器。The following example creates an anonymous pipe client and pipe server. 管道服务器使用方法从验证代码以对管道客户端读取的字节序列。The pipe server uses the method to read a series of bytes from the pipe client as a validation code. 管道客户端和管道服务器属于同一个示例。Both the pipe client and the pipe server are part of the same example. 该示例的服务器部分创建客户端进程，并将其作为参数传递匿名管道句柄。The server portion of the example creates a client process and passes it an anonymous pipe handle as an argument. [!code-cpp[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/cpp/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/vb/sample.vb#1)]

span.span: Applies the access control list (ACL) entries specified by a object to the pipe specified by the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 访问控制列表 (ACL) 介绍个人和/或组，或没有执行权限在指定的文件上执行特定操作。An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).
